intro: Coelorachis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy coelorachis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a mix of white and green hues. Coelorachis hirsuta is notable for its hairy foliage, which gives it its common name and aids in moisture retention.
